page.title: 07RELIGION IN LITTLE MALVERN
page.content: {The parish church,}part of the original monastic foundation, has as its incumbent the Rev E. Cox who lives just outside the parish in his own house. The parish of 56 is not large enough to warrant a full-time priest so Rev Cox has spent most of his time in school chaplaincy work and in teaching. The congregation on Sunday mornings at the{Eucharist}numbers about 50 and is drawn from a wide geographical area. The{Roman Catholic {church}built in 1862 serves a congregation most of whom come from outside Little Malvern. The priests are{Benedictines from Downside Abbey. There is a friendly relationship between Anglicans and Roman Catholics, congregations and priests. The Berrington family of{Little Malvern {Court,}Catholics since the Reformation have recently adopted Anglicanism.
